One possible solution:

Don't send any new password reminder requests after you have sent the first one. It does sometimes take a minute or two to arrive and if you are in hurry, the wait can be quite frustrating. 

If you send a second request for a password reset it can invalidate the first reset. This has happened to me in the past, and your description of this happening "a number of times" makes me think that this might be your problem--although I have just done a password reset myself and the email arrived within a minute.

Please do let us know how you get on.

Hi Uzma,

The problem is that Sarah (was) restricted to a specific section of the site and "restricted (to a section)" users need to select a section from the login drop down/screen when they login.

However we have long since stopped setting up user accounts in this was as it proved problematic/confusing (for the reasons Sarah just hit)

Danny probably wasn't aware of that when he setup Sarah's account as you can still setup users this way in the backend.

I've now removed the section limitation and Sarah should now be able to login as any other user,

Jamie

Er, not me guv--and for security reasons we are not supposed set up accounts these days anyway. Uzma set this one up herself--see http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/6372. Tom knows that Uzma can set up accounts and we have a pending ticket open for him to change this, which I reminded him about last week -- http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/6933

comments.value:
From: Simon Knowles <Simon.Knowles@london2012.com>

It seems there’s a couple of glitches with the advertising/trading
form that you guys put together last year. I’d appreciate it if you
could investigate and fix where necessary. The first query sounds like
a glitch that needs sorting (hopefully fairly easily...). It only
seems to happen in IE, but is fine in FF.

I’ve not been involved until now, so not sure how to remedy the second
bug, but be grateful if you could advise.

Be good if you could sort the first one as soon as possible as
applications close in a few weeks time (thank God!).

Can you take a look and let me know?

From: advertisingandtradingenquiries
Sent: 17 January 2012 13:18
To: Simon Knowles
Cc: Alice Nugent
Subject: online form - applicant query

Hi Simon

I  know we said no more amendments, but the ���type of licence’ boxes
does not show the full licence/regs name so applicants are not sure
they have made the right choice. This applies to both versions of the
form. Would Kitsite be able to widen the box so that all text is
visible?

There is also a problem with the licence expiry date for those who
have an existing licence. A lot of expiry dates are 31/07/2012 and the
website is not allowing applicants to submit forms with that date as
it does not cover the whole Games period (although applicants are
supposed to show a valid licence for Games Time, in practice these may
be not be renewed until nearer the time in which case we just need to
see a valid licence for the time of the application).  Is this a
Kitsite query, or one for James do you think? I’m not sure where the
responsibilities lie.

Give me a bell if you need me to clarify anything.

Thanks,

Sarah Clarke
Project Manager, Advertising & Trading
Olympic Delivery Authority
Direct line:  +44 (0) 203 023 6963
Marked as high.

Hi Simon,

1) ‘type of licence’ boxes does not show the full licence/regs name

Do you mean the drop down isn't fully expanding - width wise - on some browsers or is it actually missing options?

2) licence expiry date

Are you getting an error message at the top of the form when you enter "31/07/2012" (we can't see to recreate this) or is it an error when you import the data into ION (obviouyl if the latter it's an issue that needs to be raised with ION).

Jamie
Thanks for investigating. I've asked the AR team and will get back to you shortly. Simon

Jamie - see **** below

1) ‘type of licence’ boxes does not show the full licence/regs name

Do you mean the drop down isn't fully expanding - width wise - on some browsers or is it actually missing options?

**** The drop down isn’t fully expanding (certainly on Internet Explorer which I assume the majority of applicants will use).

2) licence expiry date

Are you getting an error message at the top of the form when you enter "31/07/2012" (we can't see to recreate this) or is it an error when you import the data into ION (obviouyl if the latter it's an issue that needs to be raised with ION).
**** The error appears to be at the online form end - applicants have said that they are unable to submit the form due to an invalid date of licence expiry. I haven’t been able to replicate this when I try, but we have had several emails now from people all with the same issue.

Actually I re-read both yours and Alice original email, so I think know the answer to my first question.

The drop down is an Internet Explorer specific issue in that technically drop downs (in Internet Explorer) can't expand wider than their closed state. We added some Javascript code in to try and work round this. 

We are just investigating why it's not working as expected (as it was previously). 

Unfortunately IE/Microsofts official response on this is that you can't do it and your drop downs must be no wider than the closed state.

Anyway, short answer is were investigating and hopefully will have a fix shortly (*)

(*) as it's such a common thing people want to do there are lots of workarounds, unfortunately they are all "workarounds" - it's not an officially supported feature in Internet Explorer.

With regards to the second issue, I wonder if people are entering a two digit year? 

We could allow either but I think ION expect a 4 digit year, so we may get a knock on issue if we do that.

Just checking..

(* we don't currently reformat the data we collect before sending it on to ION, we simply validate it, so it's not a trivial thing for us to just reformat the date, otherwise we would have accepted both formats and only sent the 4 year version).

Lars,

I fixed the second one, an over zealous date checker..

But the first is still an issue..

I've fixed the drop down expansion issue and its publishing. Its's a javascript/css fix so it will take a while to become visible on the live server but it should be working fine preview in internet explorer.

NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED 

 

Hi Guys 

 

With regards to the issue applicants are having submitting the form,
when entering the wrong two digit year in the date format eg: (dd/mm/yy)
rather than (dd/mm/yyyy). 

 

Can we add a tool tip (blue icon) detailing this.

 

The text should read: 

Please note that the date should be entered in this format: dd/mm/yyyy 

 

Uzma

Hi Uzma, 

I've added a question mark to the first date fields, have a look here:
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/making-it-happen/advertising-and-trading-regulations/applicationform.php

I haven't published the changes yet.
Lars

Hi Lars 

The tool tip you have created seems to be in the wrong place. It needs to be placed next to the box that reads:

Licence / contract date of expiry. 

Also can you have a look at the tool tip that is for 'Event Zone for which application is being made' it seems to have moved and is in the middle of the page in IE. Is it meant to be like that? 

Thanks 
Uzma.

Hey Uzma, i've fixed those, please check! 

Cheers 
Lars

NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED 

 

Hi Lars 

 

That is fine. Can you please publish. 

 

Thanks 

Uzma. 

 

NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED 

 

FYI - can you let ATR know if it is fixed?

 

Ta

S

It is because Akamai is caching it.
 http://www.london2012.com/images/jobs/job-hub-hl.png
displays an akamai-cached image
 http://www.london2012.com/images/jobs/job-hub-hl.png?x=y
forces akamai to re-fetch it, and is thus your updated version.
The most effective way to fix this is probably just to rename the image
(which should force a republication of the jobs front, which should then
pick up the image at the new path)
Kieran
AS the image is hardcoded in the page will it pick up the new name of the file if I change it?

In short,

This has become a massive business risk.

If you could change the filename, and ensure that the template picks up the new image, I’d be very grateful.

Will happily explain the details via phone later.

Thanks,

Tom

Ok, apologies, I hadn't realized it was hard-coded into the template.
Will fix now.
K

Fixed.
 http://www.london2012.com/jobs


> Ok, apologies, I hadn't realized it was hard-coded into the template.

Hi Tom,

"This has become a massive business risk"

For over six months now we have, on multiple occasions, expressed that LOCOG editorial (or ideally Kitsite) should have access to Akamai control panel and the ability to de-cache images/assets.

Given the the low levels of load currently on the server it may also be worth looking at reducing the levels of caching on images, down to say 30 mins, this will mean at most any given images will only be requested from the origin servers 48 times a day.

Jamie
Thank you very very much! ☺

Hi there,
I'm contacting you from the New Media Team at LOCOG. We're currently refining our SEO requirements for the Games Time Website which include our use of 301 redirects from the pre-games site.


It would be really helpful if you could provide some details on how 301 redirects are currently created and managed from with the Kitsite CMS. For example, whenever a CMS user changes the URL for a page or deletes a page, are they prompted to specify a 301 redirect for the URL of that page?

Any details you can provide would be very much appreciated. Many thanks indeed,

Jacob.

<hr width="100%">
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 
          
This E-mail is confidential.  If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return
E-mail.
             
Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.
                                     
Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">

Hi Jacob,

The 301 redirects are handled on a manual basis in the CMS
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/shorturls/

We have additional over time added in some more general / regular expression based 301 redirects to handle complete sections or more complex dynamic urls, these are added directly into the Apache .htaccess file as single mod_rewrite rules (which may apply to many urls/pages).

However, as you suggest many CMS now offer the ability to automatically create 301 redirects (from the old to the new location/filename) whenever a page is renamed or moved, which is a entirely sensible addition. 

Although I would consider limiting the ability of users to renaming section that contain a large number of pages or that are very deeply nested (or at least flag up the ganger in a alert box). As an action like that could cause a huge number of redirects being written out. If you do need to rename sections with may sub-pages it may be better to use a single regular expression based mod_rewrite (or equivalent server side redirect) rule in a server config.

The other important thing to check here is that your CMS tracks all the previous redirects in such a way that they all point to a single canonical 'current' url, as opposed to them chaining, or else you may end up with "to many redirect' errors.

We also implement what we term 'SEO urls'
These are less 'redirects' in the 301 sense and more 'neat' short urls (ie. /basketball) that are inserted into href tags by the CMS instead of the full path to the page (ie. /sport/basketball.php). With these pages the name of the 'short' name of page stays the same regardless of where it lives in the site structure. However I think this may be more specific to our current CMS implementation which has a strong notion of a hierarchical site structure that mates that of the live site in the editorial interfaces.
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/seopaths/

In terms of how to implement the redirects, that will largely depend on your CMS, but I would say you would want to do this somewhere centrally (ie. a server config, a controller, a global request handler) rather than physically replacing the old pages with a page that does the redirect (otherwise you run the risk of having redirects to redirects).

I hope that answers your questions..

Jamie

Hi Jamie,
Thanks so much for getting back to me. This is really helpful. Would it be possible to get a copy of the .htaccess file please? We can't extract a list of the singularly mapped (i.e. 1-1 mapped) URLs and wonder if it excludes all the mod_rewritten stuff too.
Any further help greatly appreciated,
Jacob

Hi Jacob,

You can access it here in the CMS
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/.htaccess

The block named "MARKETING REDIRECTS" are the ones constructed out of the CMS via the "Short URL" screen/interface.

I've also attached a copy which is a snapshot of how the file looks at this moment in time..



www.htaccess-19-01-2012.txt
Thanks Jamie. The txt file is great but I’m trying to share the htaccess with our site developer and they (nor I strangely) have permissions to access this.
Can you not access the txt file I attached? that is the .htaccess file
Apologies Jamie. Thank you

We have been asked to embed some code which will provide a link to an e-publication. It would go on this page (unless it needs to be embedded in a whole page): http://www.london2012.com/about-us/our-brand/retail-information/london-2012-retail-opportunities.php I'm not sure how this is supposed to render, so wonder if it's possible to put the code in a test page we can review?
Open publication - Free publishing - More catalogue

Hi Morag,

It looks like it's one of those PDF viewers (ah yes it's Issuu --> http://issuu.com/) 

But that viewer doesn't fit on that page, I guess we could use something like the Map template layout, but then you'd lose the left hand navigation.

Probably the nicest solution would be to get a embed that fitted that centre column (which is 460px) but then let people view it full screen (I know you can do this in Issuu's viewer, from past experience)

Ah something like this..
http://www.littlewhitelies.co.uk/the-magazine/issue-33

Or you could just link to the PDF?

Hi Jamie

Happy to lose the left hand navigation as it’s a one off page – how easy would it be to customise a template just for this?

HI Morag,

I reckon it would probably take about half a day to get everything setup and in place, see first screen grab (attached) for what ti would look like on a wide template.

Although I did a have a quick look at the Issuu (the viewer being used) docs and realised I could shrink the player/viewer to fit the central column  see second screen grab (attached).

Let me know what you'd prefer and if you want us to proceed.

Jamie
Brilliant. Reviewing this with the client – will let you know asap!

Any updates on this one?

(just doing some house cleaning!)
Tom says: by Wednesday this week, if at all possible. And wide templated preferred, if possible.

Hi Tom,

Can I just check which version you prefer, the wide (losing the left hand nav) or in the middle column, personally I think the wide is better if it doesn't need to sit in a section with other pages (and hence need the lh nav)

Jamie

I think its fine to have it in the wide template – I imagine this is easiest?

I think we need a title and text box above however – so we can offer an explanation and links elsewhere.

Thanks

Have created a page here, feel free to edit the text . move to wherever you want it to live.
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test/licensingandretailcatalogue.php

btw. is this likely to be a one off or are you going to have more of these Issuu style PDF embedded in pages? Just wondering if it's worth doing the extra work to make it more parametrized, so you can assign different publications ( btw. it's not trivial to parametrize or else we would have just done it, it's prob. half a days work). But if you are likely to have more in future it makes sense to do it now, becasue creating a new template for every publication would be equally insane.

I actually can’t edit anything on here?

This is likely to be a one off – max one more, so I think its fine to leave it as one template.

However - I can’t see the catalogue or any editable text?

Thanks

Tom, Can I check your looking at it in edit mode, it's working fine for everyone here. 
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/test/licensingandretailcatalogue.php

Also you may not see it in preview is your browsers gest upset by https and http content (the cms forces the page to be loaded as https but the embed is loaded over http). Once published this won't be an issue as both page and embed will be served over http.

comments.value:
NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED Hi both, Hope you're well? Thanks once again for all your hard work and patience with the Learning Legacy website. Everyone here is delighted with it. There are now a few last things we need to do to complete the site before I leave the ODA (in December). I have outlined the final tasks below. Please can you take a look and send over a quote for this work? I think we will need a quick chat to go through all of this in detail so that I'm as clear as I can be on what we require - how about Monday? 1. Analytics - we are being harassed about measuring the number of people visiting the site, which is absolutely something we should have thought about before. What is the cost to build the capacity to measure the number of people visiting the home page? And also another cost for the home page and theme pages? This is quite urgent, so it would be great to get this set up ASAP. 2. Accessibility - there is an issue with the accessibility style sheets, as in they don't look great. AbilityNet picked up that the pages should 'render with a layout similar to the normal site, but with bigger text and more contrasting colours'. I know you've advised that doing that would mean effectively designing a new CSS layout/design purely for the accessible versions of each page - please can we get a quote for redesigning the accessible versions of the pages? 3. Flash plug-in - there is an issue with the London 2012 logo/scrolling pictures on the home page in Internet Explorer. I think this is something to do with 'flash plug-ins', as this was the error message that came up when we loaded the site in Firefox at the ICE. Please can you explore and rectify? 4. Alt text on scrolling pictures - we need the alt text to show as a yellow box when hovering over the images so that people know where they are. I think you have said this will require a component/function adding so may have cost implications. Can we get a quote for this please? 5. Archaeology navigation - in order to get the nesting right (to mirror the site map) we had to lose the top level menu when you click on 'The investigations' and 'The sites'. This is not ideal, as it simply doesn't look great. What options do we have to amend/fix this? 6. Full list of publications - The project team want us to add an option on each theme page for a full list of publications per theme (ie a list of all micro reports, case studies, champion products and research summaries for Sustainability). Can we add a link, or another box for this? Would be great to go through the options and costs for this. 7. External links page - we would like to add in External Links for each theme page. I reckon there will be around five external websites for us to link out to, per theme. Maybe this could sit under the 'related links' on the right? Also would be great to discuss options. 8. Technical Overviews - we are publishing some technical overviews of the project, which are external papers that we just need to link to. Because these are overviews of the project, and not theme-specific, are we able to add a tab at the top, which takes you to a page about the overviews? It just needs to be a page, with information about three organisations delivering the overviews. 9. Case study summaries - there are a number of case studies being published by external organisations next year that we have the summaries/abstracts for. We need these summaries to go on the website with links to the full case studies/publishers. I suggest that these go under the case studies section, or we have another 'box' for case study summaries. However, these aren't documents to upload (as with case studies), so there will be no thumbnail and no physical PDF to link to. It will just need to be a generic image, with the summary/abstract to go into the text box next to the thumbnail, and the link will take you to an external website (rather than a PDF). Hope this makes sense? The only other catch is that the links won't be available until next year! Best to talk through this one! 10. LOCOG testing of the website - Colin Miller has been continuing to test the website since we've gone live and has picked up a few 'aesthetic niggles'. I have asked him to outline what these are and will get back to you ASAP. They are not expected to be extensive and I'm hoping we can fix these in-house. Hope this all makes sense. As suggested, let's catch up early next week and then get a lump-sum for all of these changes. I want to ensure that we are very clear from the outset and that you are paid for all the extra work you are doing. Hope you have a lovely weekend. Speak next week. Indy Rihal Marketing Manager Communications Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6457 Blackberry: +44 (0) 776 055 4135 Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place Canary Wharf London E14 5LN Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com Information owned by ODA Please delete if you are not the intended recipient

1) Accessibility issues - 1 day
The originally CSS / HTML was supplied by a 3rd party (Reading Room) Given that the site has now been constructed using those files we will need to investigate what would be retrospectively involved in us meeting all or some of Ability.net suggestions. Therefore we propose that we spend a day investigating and breaking down the work involved in meeting all of Ability.net requirements. Where possible we will simple address the issues, indeed we have already address several of the issues highlighted in Ability.net report, but some the larger issues the deliverables will simply be an estimate of work involved. We will aim to keep out recommendations sensible, in terms of costs vs the possible perfect solution if we we're starting with a blank slate.

a. Fix low hanging issues where possible
b. Supply a breakdown of work and time required to address other issues highlighted in Ability.net report (this may result in further un-costed work)

* please note, that as the site has already been built, the perfect resolution of certain ability.net issues may not be achievable by minor/medium sized "retrospective" changes and therefore could 
require very large sections of the site to be totally rewritten, we are assuming this is not a sensible route (ie. rebuilding the site is not an option) and therefore will suggest sensible compromises.

2) Add text "label" under "theme" images on home page 
Update the HTML/CSS and Javascript scroller code so that each theme image can be assigned a name, which will also hyperlink though to the relevant section.

3) Archaeology navigation
When in the 2nd level of the Archaeology navigation show the 1st level 
of Archaeology links

4) Technical overview tab
If you are happy creating a new "Technical overview" section at the root of the site in a similar manor to the "About us" section and filling it with pages (using the same templates used in the about us section).

We will add the necessary changes to
a. include an additional tab and rollovers
b. logic so this section is correctly highlighted when you are within it
c. basic help in getting the section us and running.
d. help in bulk republishing the site to include this new section

* please note, we are not proposing to create any new templates or logic (other than the tab) for this section.

5) Events tab 
Create a new “Events” tab and resize existing tabs so all fit without wrapping. Tab to be designed so we will be able to have a page for each organisation.

Lars

On the home page scroller (Learning Legacy themes) they want a text label under each image (for the name of the theme). http://learninglegacy.london2012.com/ Best leave this one in preview and lock the homepage once done.

The next ones is, my guess if  best placed to handle, are the accessibility issues (see above; in short they want it more like on www rather than running all one item after anoher). If the fixes are easy make them, anything that looks tricky make a note and leave it.

I'll deal with the the arch navigation and tabs, but may ask for your help on getting the CSS/HTML for the extra two tabs looking sweet. If you can't face accessibility issues first thing, maybe look at what needs to change to add the extra tabs. 

thanks

Jamie
close, jamie says this got a seperate po
